dataset.title: Monitoring juvenile Chinook salmon outmigration using rotary screw traps on Battle and Clear Creek

abstract.para: This is the abstract for the Battle/Clear RST EDI package.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released under the Creative Commons license - Attribution - CC BY (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). The consumer of these data ("Data User" herein) is required to cite it appropriately in any publication that results from its use. The Data User should realize that these data may be actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the authors of these data if any questions about methodology or results occur. Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Battle and Clear Rotary Screw Traps

description.para: These are the methods for the Battle/Clear RST EDI package.

project.title: Monitoring juvenile Chinook salmon outmigration using rotary screw traps on Battle and Clear Creek

attribute.attributeDefinition: Fork length of the fish
Whether or not the fish was dead. Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

textDomain.definition: Whether or not the fish was dead. Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Weight of the fish
Count of fish
Catch number used to generate passage indices for reports, plus counts are split into races, zero fork lengths have been assigned
Is RCatch value an interpolated catch for times the trap did not fish? . Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

textDomain.definition: Is RCatch value an interpolated catch for times the trap did not fish? . Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Age class of the fish, if identified. Levels = c("AGE0+", "", "YOY")

textDomain.definition: Age class of the fish, if identified. Levels = c("AGE0+", "", "YOY")

attribute.attributeDefinition: Brood year

textDomain.definition: Brood year

attribute.attributeDefinition: Common name of the fish. Levels = c("Chinook Salmon", "Hardhead", "Rainbow Trout", "Sacramento Sucker", "Sacramento Pikeminnow", "Speckled Dace", "Unidentified ammocoete", "Tule Perch", "Pacific Lamprey macropthalmia", "Threespine Stickleback", "Pacific Lamprey ammocoete", "Unidentified Cyprinid fry", "California Roach", "Riffle Sculpin", "Sacramento Sucker fry", "Golden Shiner", "Green Sunfish", "Prickly Sculpin")

textDomain.definition: Common name of the fish. Levels = c("Chinook Salmon", "Hardhead", "Rainbow Trout", "Sacramento Sucker", "Sacramento Pikeminnow", "Speckled Dace", "Unidentified ammocoete", "Tule Perch", "Pacific Lamprey macropthalmia", "Threespine Stickleback", "Pacific Lamprey ammocoete", "Unidentified Cyprinid fry", "California Roach", "Riffle Sculpin", "Sacramento Sucker fry", "Golden Shiner", "Green Sunfish", "Prickly Sculpin")

attribute.attributeDefinition: Lifestage of the fish. Levels = c("not provided", "parr", "silvery parr", "obvious fry", "smolt", "yolk sac fry", "fry")

textDomain.definition: Lifestage of the fish. Levels = c("not provided", "parr", "silvery parr", "obvious fry", "smolt", "yolk sac fry", "fry")

Sample identifier linking catch to trap table

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code referring to the station where the sample was taken. Levels = c("UBC", "LCC", "UCC")

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date sample was taken
Time sample was taken
Sample identifier linking catch to trap table

textDomain.definition: Sample identifier linking catch to trap table

attribute.attributeDefinition: The depth of the bottom of the cone
The average time per cone rotation (average of three rotations)
Reading on the flow meter at start
Reading on the flow meter at end
How long the General Oceanics meachanical flow meter (Oceanic ® Model 2030)was in the water taking a reading, used to calculate water velocity in front of the cone
River depth from inside of the river left (facing down stream) pontoon off crossbeam #2 (cone crossbeam)
River depth from directly in the center of cone off crossbeam #2 (cone crossbeam)
River depth from inside of the river right (facing down stream) pontoon off crossbeam #2 (cone crossbeam)
Was trap fishing in the thalweg at SampleDate and SampleTime. Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

textDomain.definition: Was trap fishing in the thalweg at SampleDate and SampleTime. Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Was the trap finshed at cone full-cone (1.0) or half-cone (0.5) setting. Levels = c(1, 0.5, NA)

textDomain.definition: Was the trap finshed at cone full-cone (1.0) or half-cone (0.5) setting. Levels = c(1, 0.5, NA)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Reading on the rotation counter at the end of the trap visit
Reading on the rotation counter
The number of 10-g tubs of debris removed from the trap during the sample period (volumetrically)
Water velocity measured at trap
Turbidity measured at trap
Did the trap fish on the sample date. Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

textDomain.definition: Is it a partial sample? Levels = c(TRUE, FALSE)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The date the trap was started sampling prior to the SampleDate (the beginning of the sample period)
The time the trap was started on the TrapStartDate (the beginning of the sample period)

otherEntity.entityDescription: R scripts that produce daily passage and cumulative catch tables from the raw catch table and biweekly and brood-year passage via bootstrapping
otherEntity.entityType: ZIP file containing three R scripts

unit.name: NTU
unit.description: Turbidity measured in Nephelometric Turbidity Units
